alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 4:14PM MST until September 10 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST /815 PM MDT/. * At 411 PM MST, National Weather Service Flagstaff Doppler radar thunderstorms producing heavy rain across west Sedona. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sedona, Village At Oak Creek and Red Rock State Park. This includes the following swimming holes... Buddha Beach "Red Rock Crossing" and Crescent Moon Ranch. This includes the following highways... State Route 179 between mile markers 306 and 311. State Route 89A between mile markers 368 and 372. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oak Creek, Turkey Creek, Jacks Canyon, Dry Beaver Creek and Dry Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
